author: infamousrev
content: <@301186049323958275> I saw some discussion in allcoredevs about how to specify the TTD in a good way. Would it be a good idea to specify it on the blockchain? an EL client could check a specific variable in a whitelisted contract, and an CL client could check a block-comment/Graffiti of a whitelisted set of validators.

author: infamousrev
content: <@301186049323958275> this approach would allow an emergency override of the TTD if needed.

author: sky.cactus
content: No, that gives centralized power to someone or some group to trigger the upgrade.

author: matt.nelson
content: Hi folks - Besu is looking at EL disc v5 support in the short term and weighing against merge priorities. I know that Geth and Nethermind have implemented disc v5 but is it enabled by default or optional? Do we expect peers on v5 as a majority? What is the state of back compat for v5 as well (the wiki entry is relatively old) <@&652918665943056397> <@&688090867927482525>

author: .fjl
content: Hi, I would love to discuss this more, but on vacation right now.

author: .fjl
content: There is no backwards compatibility with discv4

author: .fjl
content: But, we can run both protocols simultaneously for a while

author: .fjl
content: I think we should focus on discv4 -> discv5 transition in EL after the merge

author: suburbandad_
content: does geth and/or nethermind indicate which protocol was responsible for peer discovery?

author: ryanleeschneider
content: and really thats just for _current_ tx types, a more general formula would be `keccak256( version_byte + encoded(transaction))` since each type can specify its own encoding, RLP isn't a requirement under EIP-2718: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2718#opaque-byte-array-rather-than-an-rlp-array
